title: A Beijinger in Washington
description: The CSIS Trustee Chair in Chinese Business and Economics for a wide-ranging conversation with Professor Wang Jisi of Peking University on US-China relations.

title: The Evening: DoD Assessment of Russian Readiness, Ukraine State of Emergency, It’s Just That Simple, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers DoD Assessment of Russian Readiness, Ukraine State of Emergency, It’s Just That Simple, and More.

title: What’s Next for the China-Russia Relationship?
description: Please join the CSIS China Power Project and Freeman Chair in China Studies on February 23rd for an in-depth discussion on the future of the bilateral relationship.

title: Struggling to Survive: Gender, Displacement, and Migration in Taliban-Controlled Afghanistan
description: Afghan women, already experiencing significant sociocultural barriers, are facing increasing restrictions to participating in civil life under the Taliban. The Taliban’s measures have compounded women’s insecurity and left them with limited recourse to migrate elsewhere.

title: Sinpo South Shipyard Update: Continued Activity
description: The telescoping crane that appeared in Sinpo South Shipyard's secure boat basin in early January is still present. However, it is unclear if the telescoping crane is an indicator of continued work on 8.24 Yongung SSBA or other reasons.

title: Creating Accountability for Global Cyber Norms
description: Incidents since the 2015 GGE have shown that global agreement on responsible state behavior in cyberspace is not enough to deter malicious cyber actors. This report explores options to increase accountability for abiding by internationally agreed upon norms.

title: Reshaping U.S. Aid to Afghanistan: The Challenge of Lasting Progress
description: Humanitarian aid to Afghanistan is no substitute for an effective government and economy, writes CSIS’s Emeritus Chair in Strategy.

title: RAI Explainer: The Lifecycle of a Semiconductor Chip
description: With the global economy reeling from a shortage in semiconductor chips, policy makers have turned their attention to strengthening the resilience of the supply chain, recognizing the centrality of this technology to economic growth and national security. To better...

title: The Evening: U.S. Sanctions Russia, D.C. Trucker Protests, When the Levee Breaks, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers U.S. Sanctions Russia, D.C. Trucker Protests, When the Levee Breaks, and More.

title: Middle East Notes and Comment: When Our Middle East Friends Talk, They Talk About Hedging
description: In a recent conversation with a senior Israeli official, I asked what strategic insights he had gained from discussions with his Emirati counterparts.

title: Miscellany
description: This week, the Scholl Chair explores several issues that don’t warrant an entire column, including avocado shortages, hostage-taking in the Senate, and USMCA cases.

title: When Our Middle East Friends Talk, They Talk about Hedging
description: Dr. Jon Alterman discusses how uncertainty in a changing global environment is driving Middle Eastern countries to hedge between regional rivals, as well as between the United States and China.
